description.narrative:
Additional detail on PEPFAR financial information and terminology can be found at https://data.pepfar.gov/financial. The PEPFAR IATI activity file and PEPFAR IATI Activity File User's Guide can be found at https://data.pepfar.gov/additionalData
The EGPAF HQ Technical Assistance Coag is designed to provide rapid technical assistance for Adult, PMTCT, and Pediatric care and treatment in support of changes in global guidelines and PEPFAR shifts. Some illustrative activities that the mechanism may be used for include: • Support development and implementation of national guidelines and operational plans for scaling up HIV care and treatment Funds allocated for Program Element HL.1.6: Adult Care and Support. All facility-based and home/community-based activities for HIV-infected adults and their families aimed at extending and optimizing quality of life for HIV-infected clients and their families throughout the continuum of illness through provision of clinical, psychological, spiritual, social and prevention services. Funds allocated for Program Element HL.1.11: Treatment/Adult Treatment. Including infrastructure, training clinicians and other providers, exams, clinical monitoring, related laboratory services, and community-adherence activities. Funds allocated for Program Element HL.1.1: Preventing Mother-to-Child Transmission (PMTCT). Activities (including training) aimed at preventing mother-to-child HIV transmission, including ARV prophylaxis for HIV-infected pregnant women and newborns and counseling and support for maternal nutrition. Funds allocated for Program Element HL.1.18: Treatment/Pediatric Treatment. Including infrastructure, training clinicians and other providers, exams, clinical monitoring, related laboratory services, and community-adherence activities. objectives

The EGPAF HQ Technical Assistance Coag is designed to provide rapid technical assistance for Adult, PMTCT, and Pediatric care and treatment in support of changes in global guidelines and PEPFAR shifts. Some illustrative activities that the mechanism may be used for include: • Support development and implementation of national guidelines and operational plans for scaling up HIV care and treatment and PMTCT programs based on the WHO 2013 consolidated guidelines • Assist with strategies to scale up and evaluate Option B+ programs that are integrated with national HIV care and treatment and maternal and child health programs • Adapt and implement facility and district level supportive supervision systems that incorporate data-driven, quality improvement approaches • Develop and/or adapt tracking systems for HIV-positive women and exposed infants in MCH settings • Support design, planning, and implementation of facility-level and community engagement activities that increase demand and support adherence and retention in PMTCT and ART programs • Provide assistance in the design, implementation, and analysis of program evaluation and implementation research with development of recommendations for program improvement • Assist in design and implementation of quality improvement systems in PMTCT and adult/pediatric HIV care and treatment • Advise on design of surveillance studies of adverse pregnancy outcomes in HIV-infected countries • Strengthening district health management systems for PMTCT and adult/pediatric HIV care and treatment programs • Assist in designing innovative health systems strengthening approaches such as performance based financing • Strengthen data quality and use of strategic information for decision-making
